trans-unit.source: Set up a SQL Server virtual machine as an IPython Notebook server | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Set up a SQL Server virtual machine as an IPython Notebook server | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Set up a Data Science Virtual Machine with SQL Server and IPython Server.
trans-unit.target: Set up a Data Science Virtual Machine with SQL Server and IPython Server.

trans-unit.source: Set up an Azure SQL Server virtual machine as an IPython Notebook server for advanced analytics
trans-unit.target: Set up an Azure SQL Server virtual machine as an IPython Notebook server for advanced analytics

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to provision and configure an SQL Server virtual machine to be used as part of a cloud-based data science environment.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to provision and configure an SQL Server virtual machine to be used as part of a cloud-based data science environment.

trans-unit.source: The Windows virtual machine is configured with supporting tools such as IPython Notebook, Azure Storage Explorer and AzCopy, as well as other utilities that are useful for data science projects.
trans-unit.target: The Windows virtual machine is configured with supporting tools such as IPython Notebook, Azure Storage Explorer and AzCopy, as well as other utilities that are useful for data science projects.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Explorer and AzCopy, for example, provide convenient ways to upload data to Azure blob storage from your local machine or to download it to your local machine from blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Explorer and AzCopy, for example, provide convenient ways to upload data to Azure blob storage from your local machine or to download it to your local machine from blob storage.

trans-unit.source: The Azure virtual machine gallery includes several images that contain Microsoft SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: The Azure virtual machine gallery includes several images that contain Microsoft SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Select an SQL Server VM image that is suitable for your data needs.
trans-unit.target: Select an SQL Server VM image that is suitable for your data needs.

trans-unit.source: Recommended images are:
trans-unit.target: Recommended images are:

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise for small to medium data sizes
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise for small to medium data sizes

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads for large to very large data sizes
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads for large to very large data sizes

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise image does not include a data disk.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise image does not include a data disk.

trans-unit.source: You will need to add and/or attach one or more virtual hard disks to store your data.
trans-unit.target: You will need to add and/or attach one or more virtual hard disks to store your data.

trans-unit.source: When you create an Azure virtual machine, it has a disk for the operating system mapped to the C drive and a temporary disk mapped to the D drive.
trans-unit.target: When you create an Azure virtual machine, it has a disk for the operating system mapped to the C drive and a temporary disk mapped to the D drive.

trans-unit.source: Do not use the D drive to store data.
trans-unit.target: Do not use the D drive to store data.

trans-unit.source: As the name implies, it provides temporary storage only.
trans-unit.target: As the name implies, it provides temporary storage only.

trans-unit.source: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Connect to the Azure management portal and provision an SQL Server virtual machine
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Connect to the Azure management portal and provision an SQL Server virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link> using your account.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link> using your account.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have an Azure account, visit [Azure free
trans-unit.target: If you do not have an Azure account, visit [Azure free

trans-unit.source: trial](http://www.windowsazure.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: trial](http://www.windowsazure.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: On the Azure Management Portal, at the bottom left of the web page,
trans-unit.target: On the Azure Management Portal, at the bottom left of the web page,

trans-unit.source: click +NEW, click COMPUTE, click VIRTUAL MACHINE, and
trans-unit.target: click +NEW, click COMPUTE, click VIRTUAL MACHINE, and

trans-unit.source: then click FROM GALLERY.
trans-unit.target: then click FROM GALLERY.

trans-unit.source: On the Create a Virtual Machine page, select a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: On the Create a Virtual Machine page, select a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: image containing SQL Server based on your data needs, and then click the next arrow at the
trans-unit.target: image containing SQL Server based on your data needs, and then click the next arrow at the

trans-unit.source: bottom right of the page.
trans-unit.target: bottom right of the page.

trans-unit.source: For the most up-to-date information on the supported SQL Server images on Azure,
trans-unit.target: For the most up-to-date information on the supported SQL Server images on Azure,

trans-unit.source: see <link><linkText>Getting Started with SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link> topic in the <link><linkText>SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link> documentation set.
trans-unit.target: see <link><linkText>Getting Started with SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link> topic in the <link><linkText>SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link> documentation set.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select SQL Server VM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select SQL Server VM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the first Virtual Machine Configuration page, provide the
trans-unit.target: On the first Virtual Machine Configuration page, provide the

trans-unit.source: following information:
trans-unit.target: following information:

trans-unit.source: Provide a VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME.
trans-unit.target: Provide a VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME.

trans-unit.source: In the NEW USER NAME box, type unique user name for the VM
trans-unit.target: In the NEW USER NAME box, type unique user name for the VM

trans-unit.source: local administrator account.
trans-unit.target: local administrator account.

trans-unit.source: In the NEW PASSWORD box, type a strong password.
trans-unit.target: In the NEW PASSWORD box, type a strong password.

trans-unit.source: For more
trans-unit.target: For more

trans-unit.source: information, see <link><linkText>Strong Passwords</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: information, see <link><linkText>Strong Passwords</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the CONFIRM PASSWORD box, retype the password.
trans-unit.target: In the CONFIRM PASSWORD box, retype the password.

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate SIZE from the drop down list.
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate SIZE from the drop down list.

trans-unit.source: The size of the virtual machine is specified during provisioning: A2
trans-unit.target: The size of the virtual machine is specified during provisioning: A2

trans-unit.source: is the smallest size recommended for production workloads.
trans-unit.target: is the smallest size recommended for production workloads.

trans-unit.source: The
trans-unit.target: The

trans-unit.source: minimum recommended size for a virtual machine is A3 when using SQL
trans-unit.target: minimum recommended size for a virtual machine is A3 when using SQL

trans-unit.source: Server Enterprise Edition.
trans-unit.target: Server Enterprise Edition.

trans-unit.source: Select A3 or higher when using SQL Server
trans-unit.target: Select A3 or higher when using SQL Server

trans-unit.source: Enterprise Edition.
trans-unit.target: Enterprise Edition.

trans-unit.source: Select A4 when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014
trans-unit.target: Select A4 when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014

trans-unit.source: Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads images.
trans-unit.target: Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads images.

trans-unit.source: Select A7 when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014 Enterprise Optimized
trans-unit.target: Select A7 when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014 Enterprise Optimized

trans-unit.source: for Data Warehousing Workloads images.
trans-unit.target: for Data Warehousing Workloads images.

trans-unit.source: The size selected limits the
trans-unit.target: The size selected limits the

trans-unit.source: number of data disks you can configure.
trans-unit.target: number of data disks you can configure.

trans-unit.target: For most up-to-date

trans-unit.source: information on available virtual machine sizes and the number of
trans-unit.target: information on available virtual machine sizes and the number of

trans-unit.target: data disks that you can attach to a virtual machine, see [Virtual

trans-unit.target: For pricing information, see <link><linkText>VIrtual Macines Pricing</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow on the bottom right to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow on the bottom right to continue.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>VM Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the second Virtual machine configuration page, configure
trans-unit.target: On the second Virtual machine configuration page, configure

trans-unit.source: resources for networking, storage, and availability:
trans-unit.target: resources for networking, storage, and availability:

trans-unit.target: In the Cloud Service box, choose **Create a new cloud

trans-unit.target: service**.

trans-unit.target: In the Cloud Service DNS Name box, provide the first portion

trans-unit.source: of a DNS name of your choice, so that it completes a name in the
trans-unit.target: of a DNS name of your choice, so that it completes a name in the

trans-unit.target: format TESTNAME.cloudapp.net

trans-unit.source: In the REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK box, select a
trans-unit.target: In the REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK box, select a

trans-unit.target: region where this virtual image will be hosted.

trans-unit.target: In the Storage Account, select an existing storage account

trans-unit.target: or select an automatically generated one.

trans-unit.source: In the AVAILABILITY SET box, select (none).
trans-unit.target: In the AVAILABILITY SET box, select (none).

trans-unit.source: Read and accept the pricing information.
trans-unit.target: Read and accept the pricing information.

trans-unit.source: In the ENDPOINTS section, click in the empty dropdown under NAME, and
trans-unit.target: In the ENDPOINTS section, click in the empty dropdown under NAME, and

trans-unit.source: select MSSQL then type the port number of the
trans-unit.target: select MSSQL then type the port number of the

trans-unit.source: instance of the Database Engine (1433 for the default instance).
trans-unit.target: instance of the Database Engine (1433 for the default instance).

trans-unit.source: Your SQL Server VM can also serve as an IPython Notebook Server, which will be configured in a later step.
trans-unit.target: Your SQL Server VM can also serve as an IPython Notebook Server, which will be configured in a later step.

trans-unit.source: Add a new endpoint to specify the port to use for your IPython Notebook server.
trans-unit.target: Add a new endpoint to specify the port to use for your IPython Notebook server.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name in the NAME column, select a port number of your choice for the public port, and 9999 for the private port.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name in the NAME column, select a port number of your choice for the public port, and 9999 for the private port.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select MSSQL and IPython ports</linkText>

trans-unit.target: Accept the default Install VM agent option checked and click the the check mark in the bottom right

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Install IPython Notebook and other supporting tools
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Install IPython Notebook and other supporting tools

trans-unit.source: To configure your new SQL Server VM to serve as an IPython Notebook server, and install additional
trans-unit.target: To configure your new SQL Server VM to serve as an IPython Notebook server, and install additional

trans-unit.source: supporting tools such AzCopy, Azure Storage Explorer, useful Data Science Python packages, and others,
trans-unit.target: supporting tools such AzCopy, Azure Storage Explorer, useful Data Science Python packages, and others,

trans-unit.source: a special customization script is provided to you.
trans-unit.target: a special customization script is provided to you.

trans-unit.source: To install:
trans-unit.target: To install:

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Windows Start icon and click Command Prompt (Admin)
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Windows Start icon and click Command Prompt (Admin)

trans-unit.source: Copy the following commands and paste at the command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Copy the following commands and paste at the command prompt.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter a password of your choice for the IPython Notebook server.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter a password of your choice for the IPython Notebook server.

trans-unit.source: The customization script automates several post-install procedures, which include:
trans-unit.target: The customization script automates several post-install procedures, which include:

trans-unit.source: Installation and setup of IPython Notebook server
trans-unit.target: Installation and setup of IPython Notebook server

trans-unit.source: Opening TCP ports in the Windows firewall for the endpoints created earlier:
trans-unit.target: Opening TCP ports in the Windows firewall for the endpoints created earlier:

trans-unit.source: For SQL Server remote connectivity
trans-unit.target: For SQL Server remote connectivity

trans-unit.source: For IPython Notebook server remote connectivity
trans-unit.target: For IPython Notebook server remote connectivity

trans-unit.source: Fetching sample IPython notebooks and SQL scripts
trans-unit.target: Fetching sample IPython notebooks and SQL scripts

trans-unit.source: Downloading and installing useful Data Science Python packages
trans-unit.target: Downloading and installing useful Data Science Python packages

trans-unit.source: Downloading and installing Azure tools such as AzCopy and Azure Storage Explorer
trans-unit.target: Downloading and installing Azure tools such as AzCopy and Azure Storage Explorer

trans-unit.source: You may access and run IPython Notebook from any local or remote browser using a URL of the form https://:, where port is the IPython public port you selected while provisioning the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You may access and run IPython Notebook from any local or remote browser using a URL of the form https://:, where port is the IPython public port you selected while provisioning the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: IPython Notebook server is running as a background service and will be restarted automatically when you restart the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: IPython Notebook server is running as a background service and will be restarted automatically when you restart the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Attach data disk as needed
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Attach data disk as needed

trans-unit.source: If your VM image does not include data disks, i.e., disks other than C drive (OS disk) and D drive (temporary disk), you need to add one or more data disks to store your data.
trans-unit.target: If your VM image does not include data disks, i.e., disks other than C drive (OS disk) and D drive (temporary disk), you need to add one or more data disks to store your data.

trans-unit.source: The VM image for SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads comes pre-configured with additional disks for SQL Server data and log files.
trans-unit.target: The VM image for SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads comes pre-configured with additional disks for SQL Server data and log files.

trans-unit.source: Do not use the D drive to store data.
trans-unit.target: Do not use the D drive to store data.

trans-unit.source: As the name implies, it provides temporary storage only.
trans-unit.target: As the name implies, it provides temporary storage only.

trans-unit.source: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure storage.

trans-unit.target: To attach additional data disks, follow the steps described in <link><linkText>How to Attach a Data Disk to a Windows Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>, which will guide you through:

trans-unit.target: Attaching empty disk(s) to the virtual machine provisioned in earlier steps

trans-unit.target: Initialization of the new disk(s) in the virtual machine

trans-unit.target: The SQL Server Database Engine cannot use Windows Authentication without

trans-unit.target: To connect to the Database Engine from another

trans-unit.target: computer, configure SQL Server for mixed mode authentication.

trans-unit.target: Mixed mode

trans-unit.target: authentication allows both SQL Server Authentication and Windows

trans-unit.target: agree that you want to restart SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create SQL Server authentication logins
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create SQL Server authentication logins

trans-unit.source: To connect to the Database Engine from another computer, you must create
trans-unit.target: To connect to the Database Engine from another computer, you must create

trans-unit.source: at least one SQL Server authentication login.
trans-unit.target: at least one SQL Server authentication login.

trans-unit.source: You may create new SQL Server logins programmatically or using the SQL Server Management Studio. To create a new sysadmin user with SQL authentication programatically, start a New Query and execute the following script. Replace and with your choice of user name and password. Adjust the password policy as needed (the sample code turns off policy checking and password expiration). For more information about SQL Server logins, see Create a Login.
trans-unit.target: You may create new SQL Server logins programmatically or using the SQL Server Management Studio. To create a new sysadmin user with SQL authentication programatically, start a New Query and execute the following script. Replace and with your choice of user name and password. Adjust the password policy as needed (the sample code turns off policy checking and password expiration). For more information about SQL Server logins, see Create a Login.

trans-unit.source: To create new SQL Server logins using the SQL Server Management Studio:
trans-unit.target: To create new SQL Server logins using the SQL Server Management Studio:

trans-unit.source: In SQL Server Management Studio Object Explorer, expand the folder
trans-unit.target: In SQL Server Management Studio Object Explorer, expand the folder

trans-unit.source: of the server instance in which you want to create the new login.
trans-unit.target: of the server instance in which you want to create the new login.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Security folder, point to New, and select
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Security folder, point to New, and select

trans-unit.source: Login….
trans-unit.target: Login….

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Login</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Login</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Login - New dialog box, on the General page, enter
trans-unit.target: In the Login - New dialog box, on the General page, enter

trans-unit.source: the name of the new user in the Login name box.
trans-unit.target: the name of the new user in the Login name box.

trans-unit.source: Select SQL Server authentication.
trans-unit.target: Select SQL Server authentication.

trans-unit.source: In the Password box, enter a password for the new user.
trans-unit.target: In the Password box, enter a password for the new user.

trans-unit.source: Enter
trans-unit.target: Enter

trans-unit.source: that password again into the Confirm Password box.
trans-unit.target: that password again into the Confirm Password box.

trans-unit.source: To enforce password policy options for complexity and enforcement,
trans-unit.target: To enforce password policy options for complexity and enforcement,

trans-unit.source: select Enforce password policy (recommended).
trans-unit.target: select Enforce password policy (recommended).

trans-unit.source: This is a default
trans-unit.target: This is a default

trans-unit.source: option when SQL Server authentication is selected.
trans-unit.target: option when SQL Server authentication is selected.

trans-unit.source: To enforce password policy options for expiration, select **Enforce
trans-unit.target: To enforce password policy options for expiration, select **Enforce

trans-unit.source: password expiration** (recommended).
trans-unit.target: password expiration** (recommended).

trans-unit.source: Enforce password policy must be
trans-unit.target: Enforce password policy must be

trans-unit.source: selected to enable this checkbox.
trans-unit.target: selected to enable this checkbox.

trans-unit.source: This is a default option when SQL
trans-unit.target: This is a default option when SQL

trans-unit.source: Server authentication is selected.
trans-unit.target: Server authentication is selected.

trans-unit.source: To force the user to create a new password after the first time the
trans-unit.target: To force the user to create a new password after the first time the

trans-unit.source: login is used, select User must change password at next login
trans-unit.target: login is used, select User must change password at next login

trans-unit.source: (Recommended if this login is for someone else to use.
trans-unit.target: (Recommended if this login is for someone else to use.

trans-unit.source: If the login
trans-unit.target: If the login

trans-unit.source: is for your own use, do not select this option.)
trans-unit.target: is for your own use, do not select this option.)

trans-unit.source: Enforce password
trans-unit.target: Enforce password

trans-unit.source: expiration must be selected to enable this checkbox.
trans-unit.target: expiration must be selected to enable this checkbox.

trans-unit.source: This is a
trans-unit.target: This is a

trans-unit.source: default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.
trans-unit.target: default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.

trans-unit.source: From the Default database list, select a default database for
trans-unit.target: From the Default database list, select a default database for

trans-unit.source: the login.
trans-unit.target: the login.

trans-unit.source: master is the default for this option.
trans-unit.target: master is the default for this option.

trans-unit.source: If you have
trans-unit.target: If you have

trans-unit.source: not yet created a user database, leave this set to master.
trans-unit.target: not yet created a user database, leave this set to master.

trans-unit.source: In the Default language list, leave default as the value.
trans-unit.target: In the Default language list, leave default as the value.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Login Properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Login Properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If this is the first login you are creating, you may want to
trans-unit.target: If this is the first login you are creating, you may want to

trans-unit.source: designate this login as a SQL Server administrator.
trans-unit.target: designate this login as a SQL Server administrator.

trans-unit.source: If so, on the
trans-unit.target: If so, on the

trans-unit.source: Server Roles page, check sysadmin.
trans-unit.target: Server Roles page, check sysadmin.

trans-unit.source: Security Note: Members of the sysadmin fixed server role have
trans-unit.target: Security Note: Members of the sysadmin fixed server role have

trans-unit.source: complete control of the Database Engine.
trans-unit.target: complete control of the Database Engine.

trans-unit.source: You should carefully
trans-unit.target: You should carefully

trans-unit.source: restrict membership in this role.
trans-unit.target: restrict membership in this role.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>sysadmin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>sysadmin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Determine the DNS name of the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Determine the DNS name of the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: To connect to the SQL Server Database Engine from another computer, you
trans-unit.target: To connect to the SQL Server Database Engine from another computer, you

trans-unit.source: must know the Domain Name System (DNS) name of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: must know the Domain Name System (DNS) name of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: (This is the name the internet uses to identify the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: (This is the name the internet uses to identify the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You
trans-unit.target: You

trans-unit.source: can use the IP address, but the IP address might change when Azure moves
trans-unit.target: can use the IP address, but the IP address might change when Azure moves

trans-unit.source: resources for redundancy or maintenance.
trans-unit.target: resources for redundancy or maintenance.

trans-unit.source: The DNS name will be stable
trans-unit.target: The DNS name will be stable

trans-unit.source: because it can be redirected to a new IP address.)
trans-unit.target: because it can be redirected to a new IP address.)

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal (or from the previous step), select
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal (or from the previous step), select

trans-unit.source: VIRTUAL MACHINES.
trans-unit.target: VIRTUAL MACHINES.

trans-unit.source: On the VIRTUAL MACHINE INSTANCES page, in the DNS NAME
trans-unit.target: On the VIRTUAL MACHINE INSTANCES page, in the DNS NAME

trans-unit.source: column, find and copy the DNS name for the virtual machine which
trans-unit.target: column, find and copy the DNS name for the virtual machine which

trans-unit.source: appears preceded by http://.
trans-unit.target: appears preceded by http://.

trans-unit.source: (The user interface might not
trans-unit.target: (The user interface might not

trans-unit.source: display the entire name, but you can right-click on it, and select
trans-unit.target: display the entire name, but you can right-click on it, and select

trans-unit.source: copy.)
trans-unit.target: copy.)

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Connect to the Database Engine from another computer
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Connect to the Database Engine from another computer

trans-unit.source: On a computer connected to the internet, open SQL Server Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: On a computer connected to the internet, open SQL Server Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: In the Connect to Server or Connect to Database Engine
trans-unit.target: In the Connect to Server or Connect to Database Engine

trans-unit.source: dialog box, in the Server name box, enter the DNS name of the
trans-unit.target: dialog box, in the Server name box, enter the DNS name of the

trans-unit.source: virtual machine (determined in the previous task) and a public
trans-unit.target: virtual machine (determined in the previous task) and a public

trans-unit.source: endpoint port number in the format of DNSName,portnumber such as
trans-unit.target: endpoint port number in the format of DNSName,portnumber such as

trans-unit.source: tutorialtestVM.cloudapp.net,57500.
trans-unit.target: tutorialtestVM.cloudapp.net,57500.

trans-unit.source: In the Authentication box, select SQL Server Authentication.
trans-unit.target: In the Authentication box, select SQL Server Authentication.

trans-unit.source: In the Login box, type the name of a login that you created in
trans-unit.target: In the Login box, type the name of a login that you created in

trans-unit.source: an earlier task.
trans-unit.target: an earlier task.

trans-unit.source: In the Password box, type the password of the login that you
trans-unit.target: In the Password box, type the password of the login that you

trans-unit.source: create in an earlier task.
trans-unit.target: create in an earlier task.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Connect to the Database Engine from Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Connect to the Database Engine from Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: In later stages of the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology, you will use the <link><linkText>Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title></link> to build and deploy machine learning models.
trans-unit.target: In later stages of the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology, you will use the <link><linkText>Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title></link> to build and deploy machine learning models.

trans-unit.source: To ingest data from your SQL Server VM databases directly into Azure Machine Learning for training or scoring, use the Reader module in a new <link><linkText>Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title></link> experiment.
trans-unit.target: To ingest data from your SQL Server VM databases directly into Azure Machine Learning for training or scoring, use the Reader module in a new <link><linkText>Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title></link> experiment.

trans-unit.source: This topic is covered in more details through the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology guide links.
trans-unit.target: This topic is covered in more details through the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology guide links.

trans-unit.source: For an introduction, see <link><linkText>What is Azure Machine Learning Studio?</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For an introduction, see <link><linkText>What is Azure Machine Learning Studio?</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties pane of the Reader module, select Azure SQL Database from the Data Source dropdown list.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties pane of the Reader module, select Azure SQL Database from the Data Source dropdown list.

trans-unit.source: In the Database server name text box, enter tcp:,1433
trans-unit.target: In the Database server name text box, enter tcp:,1433

trans-unit.source: Enter the SQL user name in the Server user account name text box.
trans-unit.target: Enter the SQL user name in the Server user account name text box.

trans-unit.source: Enter the sql user's password in the Server user account password text box.
trans-unit.target: Enter the sql user's password in the Server user account password text box.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure ML Reader</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure ML Reader</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Shutdown and deallocate virtual machine when not in use
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Shutdown and deallocate virtual machine when not in use

trans-unit.source: Azure Virtual Machines are priced as pay only for what you use.
trans-unit.target: Azure Virtual Machines are priced as pay only for what you use.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that you are not being billed when not using your virtual machine, it has to be in the Stopped (Deallocated) state.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that you are not being billed when not using your virtual machine, it has to be in the Stopped (Deallocated) state.

trans-unit.source: Shutting down the virtual machine from inside (using Windows power options), the VM is stopped but remains allocated.
trans-unit.target: Shutting down the virtual machine from inside (using Windows power options), the VM is stopped but remains allocated.

trans-unit.source: To ensure you’re not being billed, always stop virtual machines from the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To ensure you’re not being billed, always stop virtual machines from the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can also stop the VM through Powershell by calling ShutdownRoleOperation with "PostShutdownAction" equal to "StoppedDeallocated".
trans-unit.target: You can also stop the VM through Powershell by calling ShutdownRoleOperation with "PostShutdownAction" equal to "StoppedDeallocated".

trans-unit.source: To shutdown and deallocate the virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: To shutdown and deallocate the virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link> using your account.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link> using your account.

trans-unit.source: Select VIRTUAL MACHINES from the left navigation bar.
trans-unit.target: Select VIRTUAL MACHINES from the left navigation bar.

trans-unit.source: In the list of virtual machines, click on the name of your virtual
trans-unit.target: In the list of virtual machines, click on the name of your virtual

trans-unit.source: machine then go to the DASHBOARD page.
trans-unit.target: machine then go to the DASHBOARD page.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click SHUTDOWN.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click SHUTDOWN.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>VM Shutdown</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>VM Shutdown</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine will be deallocated but not deleted.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine will be deallocated but not deleted.

trans-unit.source: You may restart your virtual machine at any time from the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You may restart your virtual machine at any time from the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Your Azure SQL Server VM is ready to use: what's next?
trans-unit.target: Your Azure SQL Server VM is ready to use: what's next?

trans-unit.source: Your virtual machine is now ready to use in your data science exercises.
trans-unit.target: Your virtual machine is now ready to use in your data science exercises.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine is also ready for use as an IPython Notebook server for the exploration and processing of data, and other tasks in conjunction with Azure Machine Learning and the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology (ADAPT).
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine is also ready for use as an IPython Notebook server for the exploration and processing of data, and other tasks in conjunction with Azure Machine Learning and the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology (ADAPT).

trans-unit.source: The next steps in the data science process are mapped in the <link><linkText>Learning Guide: Advanced data processing in Azure</linkText><title></title></link> and may include steps that move data into HDInsight, process and sample it there in preparation for learning from the data with Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: The next steps in the data science process are mapped in the <link><linkText>Learning Guide: Advanced data processing in Azure</linkText><title></title></link> and may include steps that move data into HDInsight, process and sample it there in preparation for learning from the data with Azure Machine Learning.
